g.text: The use of Li cell conﬁgurations for the tests aiming to oxidize
magnesium ternary nitride phases stems from the impossibility
to achieve Mg plating at the counter electrode in the alkyl
carbonate-based electrolyte employed. In contrast, the Li and
Ca electrolytes used enabled, respectively, Li and Ca metal
plating at the counter electrode, thus allowing reliable
99.5%) in a 1:1 vol mixture of EC (Sigma-Aldrich, 99%) and
PC (Solvionic, 99.9%) was used as electrolyte for the reduction
(magnesiation) tests carried out in Mg cells. Ca metal three-
O content <25 ppm were used for the
potential limitation (GCPL) and EPS steps tests were run on a
Bio-Logic VMP3 and MPG2 potentiostat/galvanostat. Poten-
tial steps of 5 mV and current threshold of C/100 (equivalent
to intercalation of 1 mol of divalent ions in 100 h) and C/100
rate were used in the EPS and GCPL tests, respectively. A
temperature equilibration of 5 h at the open circuit potential
was completed prior to measurements. The active material
Once tested, the cells were disassembled in an Ar-ﬁlled dry
box and the electrodes or active material powder were washed
and sealed in borosilicate glass capillaries for the ex situ XRD
been performed using the ab initio total-energy and molecular
dynamics program Vienna Ab initio Simulation Program
calculations based on DFT were performed for CaTaN
the general gradient approximation, with the exchange and
correlation functional form developed by Perdew, Burke, and
The interaction of core electrons with the nuclei
is described by the projector augmented wave method.
). The energy cut oﬀ for the plane
wave basis set was kept ﬁx at a constant value of 600 eV
throughout the calculations. The integration in the Brillouin
zone is done on an appropriate set of
Pack scheme. A convergence of the total
energy close to 10 meV per formula unit is achieved with such
parameters. All calculations are spin-polarized. The initial
were fully relaxed (atomic positions, cell parameters, and
volume). The ﬁnal energies of the optimized geometries were
recalculated to correct the changes in the basis set of wave
functions during relaxation. To investigate diﬀusion, the energy
barriers for Ca hops between adjacent octahedral sites in
were calculated using the nudged elastic band
method as implemented in VASP. A Ca
considered, where one Ca atom has been removed leaving a
vacant octahedral site. Constant volume calculations were
performed for ﬁve intermediate images. To calculate the
energy at the saddle point, cubic splines were ﬁt through the

Horizon 2020 research and innovation program H2020
766617) is also acknowledged. We are grateful to ALBA
synchrotron for beamtime allocation at MSPD beamline
